Island¶

The Island module¶

class biosim.island.Island(geogr)[source]¶

Represents the Island for the simulation.

Parameters

geogr – a nested lists of landscape-codes

Raises

ValueError – If the map is invalid

add_animals(population)[source]¶

A function that adds animals to the island

Parameters

population (list of dicts) – the animals that are being added to the island

Raises

ValueError – If the location is inhabitable

Note

The list will have to follow the example below:

[{‘loc’:(2,2), ‘pop’:[{‘species’:’Herbivore’, ‘age’:5,’weight’:20}, {‘species’:’Carnivore’,’age’:5, ‘weight’:20}]]

aging()[source]¶

A function that ages all animals on the island

death()[source]¶

A function that calculates the deaths of the animals on the island

feeding()[source]¶

A function that feeds all the animals on the island

loss_of_weight()[source]¶

A function that calculate the weight-loss of all the animals on the island

migration()[source]¶

A function that calculates migration for all animals on the island, and adds them to their respective lists

procreation()[source]¶

A function that calculates the births for all animals on the island, and adds them to their respective lists

yearly_cycle()[source]¶

A function that runs the annual cycle of the island

class biosim.island.Tile(landscape, loc, herbs=None, carns=None)[source]¶

A class for each tile/cell on the island

Parameters

  • landscape (class) – the landscape of the tile

  • loc (tuple e.g (3,3)) – the location-coordinates of the tile

  • herbs (list) – the current herbs on the tile

  • carns (list) – the current carnivores on the tile

add_carn_to_tile(carnivore)[source]¶

A function that adds a carnivore to the current tile.

Parameters

carnivore (Carnivore class) – the carnivore that is being added to the tile

add_herb_to_tile(herbivore)[source]¶

A function that adds a herbivore to the current tile.

Parameters

herbivore (Herbivore class) – the herbivore that is being added to the tile

animals_age()[source]¶

A function for aging all animals in the current tile

animals_dead()[source]¶

A function that calculates the death of animals on the tile, and removes them from their respective lists

animals_migrate(loc, get_map)[source]¶

A function for calculating migration for all animals on the tile. They are added to a temporary list in the new tile, and removed from the current tile.

Parameters

  • loc (tuple e.g (3,3)) – the coordinates of the current tile

  • get_map (a nested list) – the island map

animals_weight_loss()[source]¶

A function for the weightloss of all animals on the current tile

birth_animal()[source]¶

A function for calculating the births of the animals on the current tile, and adds them to their respective lists.

feed_carns()[source]¶

A function for “hunting”. The carnivores hunt in a random order, and each carnivore hunt until it is full, or has tried to kill every herbivore on the current tile. The herbivores are hunted in increasing order of fitness.

feed_herbs(fodder)[source]¶

A function for “feeding” herbivores in the current tile. The herbivores eat in descending order of fitness, until there is no more food to eat.

Parameters

fodder (int) – total amount of food in the current tile

integrate()[source]¶

A class that integrates the migrating animals into the true list containing all animals of that species in the current tile. This is done to fix the problem of animals migrating twice a year.

location()[source]¶

A function that returns the location of the tile.

:return : self.__loc__ :rtype: tuple e.g (2,3)

migrants_carns(carn)[source]¶

A function that adds a carnivore to a temporary list when it is migrating.

Parameters

carn (Carnivore class) – the migrating carnivore

migrants_herbs(herb)[source]¶

A function that adds a herbivore to a temporary list when it is migrating.

Parameters

herb – the migrating herbivore

static new_location(tile)[source]¶

A static method for finding a new tile for migration.

Parameters

tile (Tile class) – the tile that animals migrate from

Returns

new_loc

Return type

tuple e.g (2,3)

remove_carn()[source]¶

Removes the herbivores that moves to another tile

remove_herb()[source]¶

Removes the herbivores that moves to another tile

x_coordinates()[source]¶

A function that returns the x-coordinate of the tile.

Returns

self.__loc__[0]

Return type

int

y_coordinates()[source]¶

A function that returns the y-coordinate of the tile.

Returns

self.__loc__[1]

Return type

int
